name: Brazilian Bare-faced Tamarin
description: The Brazilian Bare-faced Tamarin is a small primate with a distinctive bare face.
spread_note: Found in the Amazon Basin, Brazil.
food_note: Forages in small family groups in tree canopies.
proportions: Length: 25-30 cm, tail: 35-40 cm, weight: 0.4-0.5 kg.
reproduction: Gestation about 5 months, twins often born.
attractions: Rare in zoos due to their specialized needs, but charming for their size.
projects_note: Endangered due to habitat loss; conservation is critical.
breeding: Bred in captivity for population recovery.
